item.title: Final Report for Project 'su2015miyunnsf'
item.description: Abstract: Miyun Reservoir, the most important surface source water for Beijing, has been suffered water crisis due to continuous drought and over-extraction during recent years; the Central Route of South-to-North Water Diversion Project (SNWDP) is expect to transfer water from Danjiangkou Reservoir to Miyun Reservoir in order to resolve the water shortage. The SNWDP will be bound to solve release the water crisis in the respect of “wa

Example Talk
item.description: Slides can be added in a few ways: Create slides using Academic’s Slides feature and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Upload an existing slide deck to static/ and link using url_slides parameter in the front matter of the talk file Embed your slides (e.g. Google Slides) or presentation video on this page using shortcodes. Further talk details can easily be added to this page using RMarkdown.

item.title: My favorate tools list
item.description: I prefer to use command line tools (CLI). Here is a list that I am using and enjoying. OS: debian/ubuntu (95%) + windows(5%) windows manager: FVWM reminder: conky+remind+wyrd calendar: conky+remind+web shell: zsh+tmux mail: mutt/getmail/msmtp contactor: abook document (doc): markdown (60%) + MS word (30%, under windows) + wps (10%) presentation: MS powerpoint (70%, under windows) + html5 slides (30%) scientific publish/thesis: latex (texlive) pdf reader: okular note: note editor: vim remote operating: ssh remote desktop: remmina virtual OS: virtualbox database: mysql file manager: ranger internet expolor: firefox + uzbl ftp: lftpd image editor: gimp music player: mocp video player: vlc data analysis: R/matlab/python dictionary: iciba.

item.title: Setup MySQL connection using R in GNU linux
item.description: Aim To connect mysql database using R is very important if you want to do some data analysis, I have extreamly bad experience on setting up it in GNU/linux, as I know, it is not easy to setup in windows as well. Install Install libmysqlclient-dev sudo apt-get install libmysqlclient-dev download and install RMySQL wget http://cran.r-project.org/src/contrib/RMySQL_0.9-3.tar.gz R CMD INSTALL --configure-args='--with-mysql-dir=/usr/lib' RMySQL_0.9-3.tar.gz

item.title: Using kermit for downloading data from YSI-terminal 650MDS under linux
item.description: Aim The offical ECO-Watch software only support on Windows systems. By using kermit, we can simply download data in YSI-terminal 650DMS through serial port connection. Installation apt-get install ckermit or yum install ckermit or pacman -S ckermit configuration cat ~/.kermrc set line /dev/ttyUSB0 set speed 9600 set carrier-watch off set handshake none set flow-control none robust set parity none set stop-bits 1 set file type bin set file name lit set rec pack 1000 set send pack 1000 set window 5 usage On linux terminal:

item.title: Download or upload waypoints or tracks from gps under GNU linux by gpsbabel
item.description: Aim I have got a garmin etrex gps which is very old but working pretty well; its major work is for sampling sites navigation in lakes/reservoirs. By using GPSbabel, I can easily download/upload waypoints/tracks from gps devices under GNU linux. communication through rs232 protocal My workstation doesn’t have a serial port, so I use a usb2serial cable for doing this. In my case, I could find my serial device here:

item.title: The solution for Google searching in mainland China
item.description: I have recently found a good solution for searching with google. It is not based on vpn nor host file. Just simply use http://www.gfsoso.com for google main sites and use http://www.gfsoso.com/scholar for google scholar, and so on. Good luck!

item.title: Don't let your tear be the last drop of water in the world- my peasonal logo
item.description: Inspired by Don’t let your tear be the last drop of water in the world I designed my peasonal logo. My peasonal logo This logo is basically composed of two drop tears and one drop water. The water-drop in the left side means the last drop water in the world, but also it means all bios in the planet share the same drop of water. Water give the planet life.

item.title: Schedule your time by using remind, wyrd, conky as well as rem2html
item.description: How do you schedule your time? I was using gcalcli for couple years, however, it is become very difficult to use in mainland China, due to the GFW policy; on the other hand, I prefer to using my own server other than using the server from others, in this case google calendar. So I start to find a better solution. Fortunately, I managed it by using remind, wyrd, conky and rem2html.
